items.description: The identifier of the meter reading.

identifiers.description:
- By default, the system will use combination of counter_id, meter_id, direction, and timestamp to identify a meter reading.
- Additional identifiers can be provided to identify a meter reading uniquely.
- Example:
  - ["metadata.registration_id", "metadata.business_unit"]
  - ["metadata.registration_id", "metadata.business_unit", "external_id"]

parameters.description: If not provided, the system will default to now.

200.description: Recent reading for the meter fetched successfully.

max_value.description: Maximum allowed reading value for the meter

post.description: Creates a reading along with a meter.

get.description:
Retrieves all readings specified in an interval.
If the start_date and end_date are equal, then it returns the readings of the specified date.
The start_date should be less than or equal to the end_date.

parameters.name: meter_id
parameters.description: The ID of the meter.

parameters.name: counter_id
parameters.description: The ID of the counter.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: If not provided, the system will default to 2000-01-01.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: If not provided, the system will default to today's date.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description:
Returns the first n results after the specified offset (from).
If this value is provided as -1, then it returns all results at once.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Since meter readings are cumulative, users may need to request actual consumptions, which are the difference between consecutive measurements.
If this value is provided as "cumulative", then actual readings will be returned.
If this value is provided as "relative", then actual consumption will be returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
If this value is provided as "asc", then the results will be sorted by the timestamp field in ascending order.
If this value is provided as "desc", then the results will be sorted by the timestamp field in descending order.

parameters.name: meter_id
parameters.description: The ID of the meter entity.

parameters.description: The ID of the counter entity.

parameters.description: The timestamp when the reading was created.

ActivityIdQueryParam.name: activity_id

SkipValidationQueryParam.name: skip_validation
SkipValidationQueryParam.description:
When set to true, all validations will be skipped and the system will allow the reading to be created.
If set to false or not provided, the system performs the following validations:
  Validation Rules (when not skipped)
  - Previous Reading Check:
    The new reading must be greater than the previous reading.
    Example: If the previous reading is 100 and the new reading is 50, the system will reject it.
  - Subsequent Reading Check
    The new reading must be less than the next (subsequent) reading, if one exists.
    Example: If a future reading for 2022-10-10 is 200, and you try to enter 250 for 2022-10-09, it will be rejected.
  - Future Timestamp Check
    The reading timestamp must be less than or equal to the current time.
    Example: If the current time is 2022-10-10T20:00:00Z, a reading with timestamp 2022-10-11T20:00:00Z will not be accepted.
  - Duplicate Check
    A reading is not allowed if there's already a record with the same meter_id, counter_id, and timestamp`.
  - Update Check
    When updating a reading, the system will look for an existing record with the same meter_id, counter_id, and timestamp.
    If no such record exists, it won't throw an error  the update simply won't take effect.
